key_responsibilities: briefing the representative
tracking legislation/monitoring the floor
collaborating with the rest of the legislative staff on policy ideas
staffing the representative at meetings and events

office: Office of U.S. Representative Pramila Jayapal (WA-07)
key_responsibilities: working collaboratively with the Congresswoman and her senior leadership team
possessing strong written and oral communications skills and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced setting under tight deadlines
understanding the digital media landscape and current digital trends, with experience overseeing a digital/social media program
thinking strategically and creatively
having a strong record of advocating for progressive values
being willing to work weekends and irregular hours
serving as the primary spokesperson for the Congresswoman
developing strong relationships with local and national reporters, editors, producers, bookers, and social media influencers
proactively engaging in media outreach, including pitching and fielding press inquiries
managing the development of press releases, speeches and op-eds
overseeing a robust and aggressive online communications program
supervising a Press Secretary and Digital Specialist
preparing and staffing the Congresswoman for district press events and media interviews
working collaboratively with the District Office to ensure a strong local/state media presence
requirements: minimum of two years of communications experience as a press secretary or communications director is required
women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, new Americans, people with disabilities, and members of other underrepresented communities are strongly encouraged to apply
state and/or district ties are a plus

key_responsibilities: communications planning and press strategy for D.C. and the district
drafting press materials including: remarks, talking points, newsletters, statements, press releases, and media advisories
pitching media events
assisting with the management of the Congresswoman’s social media accounts
interview preparation
overseeing the office’s franked mail and digital programs
requirements: strong ties to New York press preferred

key_responsibilities: handling constituent requests and casework on behalf of constituents with applicable federal agencies
working closely with other caseworkers and legislative staff on constituent services and outreach efforts
establishing and maintaining relationships with local organizations, community leaders, and elected officials in the district
keeping track of key issues in the communities and developing outreach efforts and course of action to Member relative to issue work
assisting with events and other activities
staffing the Member at meetings and events or attending on behalf of the Congresswoman
conducting research, drafting memos and letters for constituent outreach and Member support
availability to work night and/or weekends as necessary to attend events and community meetings
providing administrative assistance as needed, including answering phones, writing correspondence, and greeting constituents
requirements: experience working in a fast-paced environment
excellent verbal and written communication skills
must have car and valid driver’s license
salary:
Pay is commensurate with experience
Health, dental, vision, transit, retirement and life-insurance benefits available
Federal student loan repayment program available, if eligible

drafting press releases and op-eds

key_responsibilities: depositions
transcribed interviews
whistleblower interviews
briefings
congressional hearings

demonstrated commitment to civil rights and social justice
background in anti-discrimination employment, whistleblower protection, and retaliation laws

developing and implementing of policy objectives, strategies and operating plans
directing all activities and staff of the district offices
recruiting, hiring, training, and managing district staff
ensuring that district staff complies with office policies, practices, and procedures

strategizing, developing, and implementing district communications and outreach plan for constituents
casework management
serving as the primary liaison between the Congresswoman and constituents and special interest groups in the district
acting as an advisor for the Congresswoman on local concerns, district issues and politics, and other developments throughout the region

strong ability to provide necessary organization, leadership and motivation to manage a Congressional office
excellent oral and written communication skills
thorough knowledge of the legislative process
willing to work long hours (including evenings and weekends) in a fast-paced and demanding setting
Spanish fluency and Southern California ties are a plus
